column4: what is happening at boot time to make ubuntu think I'm 'out of disk'??
'out of disk' is the error I'm getting when I try to boot.
Ah, sounds like some partitioning error, boot from a cd and fsck your hard drive
got it... I'm reading the man page now.  Thanks for the suggestion!  Hope that does the trick!
when i try to run fsck (fsck -As) all I get is 'fsk form util-linux-ng 2.16' and back to the prompt (ubuntu@ubuntu: ~$')
Try just "fsck". Also, that must be run as root.
I tried 'sudo fsck' and got same thing...
Huh. So most likely filesystem is sane. Weird.
how do i make sure I'm root?  I tried 'su" and I'm asked for password... but I'm using the liveCD..
su is not working anymore, it's old. sudo -i
no luck.. I did manage to make sure I'm root... but fsck does not do anything.. just returns the "fsck from util-linux-ng 2.16"
Crap. Guess i was wrong from the beginning.
thanks for the help anyay.  Anyone else have a suggestion?
